result.execSummary:
The defendant Sterling A. Greyhair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
Restitution is to be paid at $100 per month during the term of probation and to continue after probation is completed until paid in full.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment, full-time higher education, or a combination thereof satisfactory to probation agent.  You may not leave employment without the approval of your agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment or counseling, including in-patient treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment or counseling, including in-patient treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any unlawful drug users.

Defendant must submit to frequent random urinalyis and  PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  Credit for 114 days jail served.

Must call probation at (715) 284-4747 within 1 hour of release from jail and must report immediately.  If released after probation office hours then must call no later than 9:00 a.m. the following day.

Jail credit of 121 days granted.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sterling A. Greyhair
Current: PO Box 132, C/O Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901-0132 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2015)
Prior: E11214 Littlegeorge Road, C/O Morning Star Leonard, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States

Defendant appeared in custody from Columbia County Jail with counsel Robert Gardner.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox clarifies that Counts 1 & 2 are sentencing after revocation and Count 3 is to be sentenced.  Fox also requests the restitution amount be amended to $13,175.00; states there is 391 days jail credit.  Attorney Gardner has no objection to the change in restitution and agrees with the amount of jail credit.  State recommends 9 months jail on Count 1 and 90 days on Count 2 consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 270 days resulting in being sentenced to time served on both counts.  Recommendation on Count 3 is 3 years probation and all recommended programming must be completed and must report to probation immediately.  Defense has no objection to recommendation by the State.  Defendant speaks.  Court adopts the joint recommendation as follows:  Count 1 sentenced to 9 months with credit for time served; Count 2 sentenced to 90 days with time served.  Costs are Counts 1 & 2 are coverted to civil judgment with the amended restitution amount being added onto Count 3.  Sentence on Count 3:  Sentence withheld and placed on probation for 3 years with following conditions:  Must call probation at (715) 284-4747 within 1 hour of release from jail and must report immediately.  If released after office hours then must call no later than 9:00 a.m. the following day.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and pay the court costs.  Must set up a payment plan with agent for restitution repayment.  Felony warning given.  Warrant quashed.
sent copy of ROAW to Judge B.

Plea hearing on August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Josiah N..  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Sterling Greyhair must appear @ Lake Delton Police Department or Sauk County Sheriffs Dept at least one time every 24 hour period and they must notify Jackson County Sheriff's Office one time per day between 8:00 a.m. - 10:00 a.m.
Called back at 3:00 p.m.
